page.title: 16LLANSTEFFAN AREA: WORSHIP
page.content: Although church and chapel attendances are low, religious observance is an important element in our life. There is tolerance and co-operation between all the denominations. The vicar lives in Llansteffan and ministers both to St Ystyffan's Church there and to Holy Trinity, the 19th century church at Llanybri. The 4 non-conformist chapels are Llansteffan: Moriah Calvanistic Methodist, Bethany Baptist, Bethel Independent, Llanybri: Capel Newydd Independent. Only Bethany Baptist has a regular incumbent; all the others depend on visiting ministers. Only Bethany has a Sunday School and children of all denominations go to it. The nearest Roman Catholic Church is at Carmarthen; the priest regularly comes to celebrate Mass at Llansteffan Memorial Hall.
